Posts.Content: labpsb wrote: My Lynne is such a trooper,,,  we can't seem to get her into remission and the fight has been so grueling.  I won't rehash what has been going on its all in past posts. My question is for my selfish research... ABT: 888 are Abbott Laboratories drug that many like Lynne (trip neg) and chemo resistant cancer hope is a breakthrough in research. We are trying to get Lynne into one of these studies; we have one tumor area in her left region attached to the chest wall that is so resistant to chemo..In fact chemo thus far has been a huge disappointment.  Avastin/Exoloda/Ixempra/Taxotere/Taxol/Carbo/AC and others. With Lynne's extensive treatment history since dx 05/07 she may be ineligible for this trial plus the line is a mile long.  I have to plan for our future and Abbott stock is looking good.  If I am not violating any protocols I would like to ask those of you currently on abt:888 how you are doing?  Lynne and I pretty much know now after 4 weeks if a chemo regiment is going to produce positive results. Lynne is actively looking into a new treatment location since leaving Kaiser last month.  We consulted with Rita Mehta UCI, Dr Ho Good Sam/MD Anderson, and have an appointment with COH on the 14th.  Dr Ho will maintain her current chemo, Carbo/Abraxane/Avastin until we get settled. Parp inhibitors probably won't be out in active treatment if successful for 5 or so years.  Any comments on how it's working would be appreciated. Thank you Paul Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Parp Inhibitors / ABT:888 labpsb labpsb

Posts.Content: Dec 27, 2007 05:46PM labpsb wrote: Hi Carol, they just removed my wife's drains yesterday, they were a bit upset that the site was red and they said it was slightly infected.  They told Lynne it would be open for about a day and a half.  They would continue to drain,  and she could wash them even get soap in the holes.  After she was to put antibiotic ointment on it.  Due to heavy radiation they did not even put a bandage over them. OK now for your web name......."golfer 779"  I have got that figured out. Golf - you're golfer and love golf 79                  - is 7 (handicap plus 72 par) = 79 = golfer779 I turned 50 this year and was set to play in several senior events in Texas when my wife Lynne received the word of IBC.  So we focus on the important things (LIFE) and I will do the golf later. Good Luck Get Well SOON.... Fellow Golfer Paul ps the kids get me a wider water ski each year
Posts.Title: Drainage at Tube Removal Site golfer779 golfer779
